comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Ex US Navy Douglas A-1G Skyraider 135036 in period USAF Southeast Asia (SEA) scheme of Tan (FS30219), Dark Green (FS34079), and Medium Green (FS34102) over Light Gray (FS36622) undersides. White tail code AD of 4407 Combat Crew Training Squadron and serial on base of tail marked as AF 52 036 as per US Air Force taste. Pictured after a rain storm as static exhibit at an airshow from the folded wing and undercarriage of a Grumman F4F Wildcat alongside. The Douglas Skyraider originally served with the US Navy from late early 1940s to late 1960s. After retirement from the US Navy many single and dual seat A-1 Skyraiders were acquired by the US Air Force, refurbished and modernised for service mostly in South East Asia. From 1962 the multi seat AD-5N Skyraider designation changed to A-1G. 4407 Combat Crew Training Squadron was based at Hurlburt Field, Eglin Air Force Base, Florida and trained all USAF Skyraider pilots. A July 1971 4407th CCTS A-1 Skyraider inventory includes 135 036: skyraider.org/hook/skytail.htm#anchor470101 4407th CCTS picture webpage: www.skyraider.org/skyassn/otherpics/mignard/4407ccts/4407... It's not yet known from internet sources the history or eventual fate of A-1G Skyraider 135036.
